intro: Distasis concinna, commonly known as the narrowleaf distaff. It is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants like buckwheat and sorrel. It has slender, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are clustered in dense, spike-like inflorescences, typically blooming in late spring to early summer.
